title: Permanently Banned
body:
Got permanently banned while my cousin used my account , I have hundreds of dollars and hours invested in this account. You're basically giving me no option to get it back? Why not just delete chat to those who are no capable of using in a correct manner. They were instigating the toxic talk as well , even though I have a history of being toxic I should atleast be able to get it back in a longer period of time then the old normal 2 week ban. 

- Just wanna play

replies.body:
_while my cousin used my account_

Said everyone who got banned.

First, letting other people use your account is punishable by permban anyway, as far as i know.

Second, you are entirely responsible for this and should not let an untrustworthy person use your account, the first issue nonwithstanding.

Third, i suggest roasting your (hypothetical?) cousin.

Permanent bans are permanent, unless you can give proof the ban is unwarranted, which in this case you definitely cant, without just getting banned for something else.  Make a new account, be smarter this time.

The system makes absolutely zero sense , I invested hundreds of dollars into this game. Every time I got banned I was being attacked by toxic players as well , the whole concept of who gets to report first is ridiculous. Why doesn't Riot remove my chat , this isn't how a loyal customer of 4 years should be treated. I understand I broke the rules but having my cousin play my account and saying non racist , non homophobic things is worth perma ban? All my money is being stolen here , the whole concept of being able to lock someone out of their account that they have invested tons of money in is already ridiculous

The idea of being able to buy your way out of responsibility is ridiculous.

This is not the american court system, fortunately. You stand or fall by your own actions, not how hard you can bribe the system and cry about being a taxpayer.

(Git rekt skrub)

> The idea of being able to buy your way out of responsibility is ridiculous.

This is not the american court system, fortunately. You stand or fall by your own actions, not how hard you can bribe the system and cry about being a taxpayer.

(Git rekt skrub)

Obviously you're not trying to be constructive , this system doesn't work and the power balance is way outta control. I know you have been toxic before so sit down.

Yes, i had a chat restriction years ago, and i fully accept it was my fault for loosing my patience, and did not expect special treatment because i spent some money or a weird misconception about being justified.

That has nothing to do with the fact you are an entitled little shit. You wont get your account back by making a big scene about how special you are on the forums.

> Every time I got banned I was being attacked by toxic players as well , the whole concept of who gets to report first is ridiculous.

You were banned for how you responded, not for being attacked. You could have muted them and moved on with your day, or you could have replied to them in a civilized manner, but you decided to drop to their level and you both got what you deserved for that. 

It has nothing to do with the number of reports or who reports first, as the chat gets looked at by an automated system.

> Why doesn't Riot remove my chat

They tried that before, with infinitely stacking chat restrictions. Those players still couldn't behave themselves, and it's said that many of them started trolling when frustrated and they couldn't flame.

Basically blame those who came before you for ruining your chance at such a system.

> I understand I broke the rules but having my cousin play my account and saying non racist , non homophobic things is worth perma ban? 

Anything that's worthy of a 10 game chat restriction is worthy of a permaban if you keep it up long enough. I'm assuming it was for chat that your account got banned because of how often you referenced the idea of removing chat.

>  this isn't how a loyal customer of 4 years should be treated. [...] All my money is being stolen here , the whole concept of being able to lock someone out of their account that they have invested tons of money in is already ridiculous

Care to show me where Riot hacked into your bank account and stole from you? 

Riot promised you RP in exchange for money, but made it perfectly clear in the Terms of Service you agreed to every single patch for 4 years straight that you did not own the content. They also told you what would result in account termination. 

Riot delivered the RP every single time, holding up their end of the agreement. It's you who broke the agreement.

> They tried that before, with infinitely stacking chat restrictions. Those players still couldn't behave themselves, and it's said that many of them started trolling when frustrated and they couldn't flame.

Basically blame those who came before you for ruining your chance at such a system.

> The system is horrible and players get a kick outta banning players. Riot's system will never resolve it's problem , everyone is toxic because you allow them to be. 

You're contradicting yourself here.

If everyone is toxic, and people get a kick out of getting other banned, then we'd all be permabanned. If on the other hand Riot allows people to be toxic, how did you get banned for being toxic?

You're not banned for playing differently.

Basically blame those who came before you for ruining your chance at such a system.

> [{quoted}](name=CKL Mom,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=QagtVQZ4,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2017-05-14T21:16:39.827+0000) I didn't share my info , he played on my computer. 

Unfortunately, this is still against the Terms of Use.

>I can't understand how people get on their high horses and act like this is the court of law. 

-shrug-

I'm really just here to help people understand the rules that are in effect, why they got banned, and what, if anything, they can do now. If you consider that a high horse then I apologize -- my post may need editing for tone.

>Permanent bans seem ridiculous unless cheating , hacking or ddosing is happening.

This is one where we can agree to disagree.

> I wasn't being toxic when I had chat restrictions, why not just remove chat.

Riot actually tried a permanent chat restriction in the past -- it didn't have a high success rate, as many of the players with it either found it amusing to see how high they could stack it, or found other ways to be toxic. While I understand it may work for you personally, Riot decided the low success rate wasn't worth the system's continued existence, and cut the experiment.

As for removing chat entirely? You could, but I believe Riot is operating on the basis that it has enough money -- it doesn't need people playing the game if the only way they can be civil is to be denied the ability to communicate at all. That's their choice, and one that I doubt we could reverse -- even if some of us didn't agree with it.

> As for removing chat entirely? You could, but I believe Riot is operating on the basis that it has enough money -- it doesn't need people playing the game if the only way they can be civil is to be denied the ability to communicate at all. That's their choice, and one that I doubt we could reverse -- even if some of us didn't agree with it.
